intro.text: You want to buy a house and need a loan...
To realise this dream you must build up your credit rating...
A good credit rating will show the bank that you are a responsible customer, able to pay off your debts...
To increase your credit rating you will need a credit card...
Now you have the choice to pay by cash or card...
Paying by card will build up your credit rating...
Paying by cash will reduce your savings...
You will be paid monthly and need to decide how to manage your bills.

finaleWin.text: You walk into the bank with your head held high...
Thanks to your excellent credit rating, you're sure the bank will want to lend to you!
You sit down with a lovely bank advisor who talks about your many options...
You walk out of the bank, not quite believing you will soon be a homeowner!

finaleLose.text: You walk into the bank, feeling a bit nervous...
You could have been more careful with your money...
You sit down with a lovely bank advisor who gently tells you that they can't help you...
You walk out of the bank, diappointed with the outcome but keen to learn how to handle money better in the future.

chapterOne.text: Now you have a credit card, you need to learn how to use it...
To build credit you need to start spending on your card...
Be careful because everything you spend must be paid back...
Think about how much money you spend each month...
and how much you get paid.
How will you pay back the money you owe?
There is an opportunity to get a better job...
It will cost you some money now but could lead to a bigger monthly wage in the future.
Your friends want to go on holiday and you want you to go with them...
The holiday dates and the opportunity to get a better job are on the same days...
What do you want to do?
Let's hope you made the right choice!
It's the end of the month and you have bills to pay!

chapterTwo.text: A friend is having a party, you need a new outfit
What are you going to wear? Remember to spend what you can afford!
Good choice! You are going to be the sharpest dressed at the party!
It's the end of the month and you have bills to pay!

chapterThree.text: At the party you went for an unexpected swim...
Maybe you were pushed in the pool...
Either way you need to get a new phone!
Do you choose a contract phone?
If you are trying to improve your credit rating...
...and are comfortable with paying for it monthly, using a credit card can be useful.
Sometimes if you have enough, it can be smart to pay with cash...
This avoids the responsibility of taking out a contract
...and gives you more control over future financial decisions
Which kind of phone do you want? Sim only, contract or second hand?
You are sure your new phone will serve you well...
But you won't be taking it anywhere near a pool for a while!
It's time to pay those bills!

chapterFour.text: You want to buy your own home...
Where you can be your own boss!
Buying a home costs a lot of money...
and you need to build up a good credit rating...
so you can borrow money from the bank...
You can improve your credit rating in two main ways...
Paying with your credit card and paying it off each month is a good way to do this
What do you want to do tonight?
I'm sure you'll have a great time

educationSnippets: Using a credit card can help build good credit when managed well.
You have more purchasing options when using a credit card.
A credit card can help if you are in need of emegency funds.
Some credit cards will offer rewards for choosing to go with their card.
There can be a temptation to spend more when you own a credit card.
Due to the workings of a credit card using one will reduce your future income.
Misuse of a credit card can lead to debt.
Although security is improving you can be exposed to credit card fraud.
Credit cards can come with confusing terms and conditions.
Using a credit card is often quicker than paying in cash.
Certain laws protect you as the consumer if you pay with plastic and lose your receipt.
You can pay off credit debt in installments if necessary.
Using a credit card at a cash machine will incur an extra cost

randomEvents.text: You have been offered overtime at work.
You found £5 on your way to work.
You found £20 on your way to work.
Happy Birthday! Your family and friends gave you £100.
Merry Christmas! Your Nanna gives you a Christmas card with £10 in.
Your bike needs servicing, you take it to the bike shop to be repaired. Lose £40!
You need to buy new trainers. Lose £60!
Your prescription is ready. You go to the chemist to collect it. Lose £15!
Your kettle is broken, you buy a new one. Lose £25!
Your bike is stolen but you still have to get to work. Buy a new one. Lose £100!
